segments.text: I notice the woman is completely zoned out, just drying that plate over and over.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring out, and she doesn’t even react.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she’s in her own little world right now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are being so bold, taking those cookies right behind her back.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is stretching so far, I’m surprised he hasn’t fallen yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for her turn, like it’s all part of the game.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful, it’s almost surreal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s like the inside and outside are two different realities.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’ll ever notice what’s happening around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene is just a disaster waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like shaking her to wake her up from her trance.
segments.speaker: PAR
